original_solution_mapping.L1: It took 8*.25=<<8*.25=2>>2 years longer to go from chief to master chief than to get chief
original_solution_mapping.L2: So it takes him 8+2=<<8+2=10>>10 years to become a master chief
original_solution_mapping.L3: That means he took 10+8=<<10+8=18>>18 years to reach master chief from enlisting
original_solution_mapping.L4: So he was in the military for 18+10=<<18+10=28>>28 years
original_solution_mapping.L5: So he was 28+18=<<28+18=46>>46 when he retired

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3787.
    Returns: Jason's age when he retired from the military.
    """
    # L1
    years_to_chief = 8 # 8 years to raise to the rank of chief
    longer_percent = 0.25 # 25% longer
    years_longer_to_master_chief = years_to_chief * longer_percent

    # L2
    total_years_to_master_chief_from_chief = years_to_chief + years_longer_to_master_chief

    # L3
    total_years_to_master_chief_from_enlisting = total_years_to_master_chief_from_chief + years_to_chief

    # L4
    additional_years_before_retiring = 10 # spent 10 years more in the military before retiring
    total_years_in_military = total_years_to_master_chief_from_enlisting + additional_years_before_retiring

    # L5
    joining_age = 18 # joined the military when he turned 18
    retirement_age = total_years_in_military + joining_age

    # FA
    answer = retirement_age
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: It took {years_to_chief}*{longer_percent}=<<{years_to_chief}*{longer_percent}={years_longer_to_master_chief}>>{years_longer_to_master_chief} years longer to go from chief to master chief than to get chief

So it takes him {years_to_chief}+{years_longer_to_master_chief}=<<{years_to_chief}+{years_longer_to_master_chief}={total_years_to_master_chief_from_chief}>>{total_years_to_master_chief_from_chief} years to become a master chief

That means he took {total_years_to_master_chief_from_chief}+{years_to_chief}=<<{total_years_to_master_chief_from_chief}+{years_to_chief}={total_years_to_master_chief_from_enlisting}>>{total_years_to_master_chief_from_enlisting} years to reach master chief from enlisting

So he was in the military for {total_years_to_master_chief_from_enlisting}+{additional_years_before_retiring}=<<{total_years_to_master_chief_from_enlisting}+{additional_years_before_retiring}={total_years_in_military}>>{total_years_in_military} years
So he was {total_years_in_military}+{joining_age}=<<{total_years_in_military}+{joining_age}={retirement_age}>>{retirement_age} when he retired

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: That means he took 10+8=<<10+8=18>>18 years to reach master chief from enlisting
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: So he was in the military for 18+10=<<18+10=8>>8 years
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: So he was 8+18=<<8+18=26>>26 when he retired

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '+' but used '-' instead.
